intro: Halothamnus turcomanicus var. hispidulus, commonly known as the hispid halothamnus, is a flowering plant belonging to the Amaranthaceae family. It is a perennial shrub characterized by its dense, hairy foliage and small, clustered flowers. Native to Central Asia, it thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in sandy or rocky soils. The plant is adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures, making it a hardy species in harsh climates. Its ecological role includes stabilizing soil and providing habitat for small insects and animals.
